text: Mahogany pour. Aroma is cites/resiny hops and malt. Sweet malt start then a dry rye. A solid grapefruit zesty hop finish. Medium body smooth nice bitter. From a bottle that had it been fresh I would have scored it higher. solid
Draft at Common Market. Clear golden yellow color. Light spice aroma. Taste of floral spice lightly bitter and nicely dry finish. Very tasty.

Nice looking copper, clear, with thin white foam. Smells like sweet caramel and rye toast with some piney, resiny notes. Taste is sweet toffee and caramel, with a resiny, rye-ish crisp finish. Pretty good.

12 oz. looks like it may have been bottled 07 25 16. Reddish-copper with a thin film of foam. Nose of spicy whole grain bread, toffee and a jot of fish sauce. Tastes of earthy toast, citrus zest, resin and toffee. Medium-plus body has smooth low-medium carbonation and a big healthy dose of rye and hop to counter the rich malt. Very nice.

12 oz bottle of an unfiltered IPA (not a red ale) "aggressively hopped with ... Citra & Amarillo hops". "90 IBU"

Im not sure how the formulation differs from their Hi-Pitch India Pale Ale, which I had just yesterday, but this is clearly different. The Lion Tamer ("Red" not part of the current labeling) is a bit more bitter, has a darker and redder body, and is markedly more hoppy, especially in the nose. Altogether, it is as different as one might expect from an entirely different brewer. Both, however, have a similar and very good mouthfeel, with ample but soft carbonation, a medium body, and light dryness.
Bottle. Pours reddish amber off white head. Nose/taste of rye, toffee, sap and caramel. Medium body.
Tap @ Hi-Wire. Copper color. Danky hops nose. Amber Ale flavor. Caramel malts. Hints of rye tingle. I love this beer. (4178)

Bottle. Pours an amber color with white head. Caramel, piney, slight bark aromas. Pretty strong up front flavor of fresh pine, wood, bitter, caramel. Pretty solid, fresh beer. A lot better than the last 3 beers Ive had by Hi-Wire.

Out of a bottle this pours a amber color with a light white head. Very complex flavors with rye being the leader. Tastes of toasted grains, bread and straw. Very bitter finish that leaves you really wanting another sip!

Half pour at Foggy Mountain Brewpub. Beautiful appearance- rich copper color with generous, thick white head. Decent legs. Nose is full of pine and citrus and caramel malts- taste follows. Finishes on the bitter side and rye is there, but could even be more pronounced for me. Somewhat slick/oily mouthfeel in a very satisfying way. Does not drink like the 7% or 90IBUs it has- really well done. One of my favorites from these guys.
From tap at brewery. Pours a amber in color with a thin head. aroma has a wonderful sweetness with rye and grapefruit. Taste follows with a nice bitterness.

Pours a cloudy reddish amber with a thick sudsy off white head. Pretty nice flavor--lots of rye and bitter pine and grapefruit hops. Caramel
Malt balances things out a little but still finishes mainly bitter.
Sharp and hazy red orange with one finger of soft tan head. Nose is soft and malty with some spicy notes and citrusy notes. Flavor is very bitter, very bitter. Cant get much else out of it.

Pint at brewery. Good aroma. Sweet. Malty. Hoppy. Nice. Blend of rye, caramel, citrus. Great looking beer. Brownish orange color. Good head and lace. Bitter sweet flavor.. medium body. Creamy oily mouthfeel. Bitter finish. Good brew. Love appearance.
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text: Draft at the brewery. Pours a clear copper color with a medium frothy tan head. Good head retention. Aroma of caramel malts and mild rye. The taste is toasted caramel malts and a spicy rye finish. Medium bodied.

draft dark red color with white head. nice malt and hop aroma with a touch or spice from rye. the flavor you get a good dose of hops and spice from the rye. medium bodied that is blended well together. nice over all flavor.

10 oz. pour at the brewery. This is murky brown color with a small head. The aroma is nicely hoppy and grassy with thick rye and caramel. Good hop use in the flavor as well. It stays grassy and citrusy balanced by the dry rye spiciness and sweeter suggestions of toffee. It gets pretty sticky after a few sips. Pretty good brew.
